thread.title: Best 17: Chooks’ Origin stars could face chop
thread.title_full: Best 17: Chooks’ Origin stars could face chop

title: Best 17: Chooks’ Origin stars could face chop
text:
Source: FOX SPORTS WE’RE going to see a new-look Roosters backline in 2017. 
The Tricolours have made two key acquisitions to their squad in premiership-winning five-eighth Luke Keary and veteran fullback Michael Gordon. 
While Keary will likely slot straight into the halves alongside Mitchell Pearce, it’s how the rest of the backs will line up which will no doubt cause coach Trent Robinson a few headaches. 
At his disposal, Robinson has Gordon, Blake Ferguson, Shaun Kenny-Dowall, Dale Copley, Daniel Tupou and rising stars Latrell Mitchell and Joseph Manu. Sydney Roosters recruits Michael Gordon and Luke Keary. Picture: Gregg Porteous Source: News Corp Australia 
Gordon is tipped to take over the custodian role where the likes of Mitchell and Ferguson played last season without great success. 
Mitchell struggled at times in the No. 1 jumper, but there’s no denying his talent. If he made the move to the centres, he could be incredibly dangerous with some early ball, a la Greg Inglis. 
Ferguson is coming off a stellar Four Nations campaign with the Australian side, where he played out wide, and will be the all the better for the experience. 
That leaves New Zealand international Kenny-Dowall and former NSW Origin representative Daniel Tupou to likely take the final two spots, but that doesn’t mean there’s no competition for them either. 
Over the next month, foxsports.com.au will be previewing your team’s best 17. 
As always, there will be some contentious decisions — and some unlucky omissions.
